Name: Kinu
Fate:
sunk 26 October 1944
bombed by USN aircraft
SW of Masbate, Sibuyan Sea
11°45′N 123°11′E﻿ / ﻿11.750°N 123.183°E﻿ / 11.750; 123.183
Propulsion:
4 shaft Gihon geared turbines
12 Kampon boilers
90,000 shp (67,000 kW)
Range: 9,000 nautical miles (17,000 km) at 10 knots (19 km/h)
Armament:
(Initial)
7 × 14 cm/50 3rd Year Type naval guns
2 × 8 cm/40 3rd Year Type naval gun s
8 × 533 mm (21.0 in) torpedo tubes  (4x2)
48 naval mines
(Final) 5 × 14 cm/50 3rd Year Type naval guns
2 × 12.7 cm/40 Type 89 naval gun s
2 × triple, 2x twin Type 96 25 mm AA guns
10 × Type 93 13.2 mm machine guns
8 × 533 mm (21.0 in) torpedo tubes  (4x2)
Armor:
Belt: 60 mm (2.4 in)
Deck: 30 mm (1.2 in)
